result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Mario Jenkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and domestic violence surcharge by 04-11-16. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

Provide a DNA sample; pay costs and DNA surcharge

48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Mario Jenkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packet

Defendant Steven Mario Jenkins in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 3:  Court sentences defendant to serve 16 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 16 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant to pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and domestic violence surcharge by 4-11-2016.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Steven Mario Jenkins in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to Counts 1 & 2:
 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.

As to Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered. 

All parties are notified that effective January 30, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackermann-Havas, Branch 45,  in Room 504 Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Steven Mario Jenkins in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial conference held. Case remains calendared for jury trial scheduled for 1/25/2016 at 8:15 a.m. in Branch 38.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Steven Mario Jenkins not in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Violation Report received from Justice Point for defendant for a Positive Breathalyzer Test.  When Matthew McCallum, from Justice Point, accompanied defendant to the courtroom to address the violation, defendant proceeded to vacate the building.  Case called at 11:15 am.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue. Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 8-10-2015 at 8:30 am, in Branch 4.  Court ordered case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 4 on 8-10-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Steven Mario Jenkins in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Steven Mario Jenkins in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
